intro: Habenaria spiranthes, commonly known as the spiral orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to various regions in Asia, Africa, and the Americas. This herbaceous plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshes. Its flowers are small and clustered in spiral arrangements, giving the plant its common name. The orchid has a rhizomatous root system and produces showy, often fragrant blooms. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
